title: Are Cherokee Indians Native Americans? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Yes, because they were born here, not because they have more of a right to be called native Americans than the rest of us do. Originally from the Southeast, especially Georgia, they were forced to move to Indian Territory (now Oklahoma). They were the most closely assimilated at the time they were forced out of Georgia. They had a written language, lived like their white neighbors, and even owned slaves. Many of them fought for the South in the Civil War. As punishment, Indian Territory was opened to white settlement and allowed to become a state.

Howdy, The name first appears on maps in Canada, later they were in Virgina then North Carolina. 1795 Treaty with Creeks stripped lands along Carolina Georgia border giving parts to Cherokee. They were in Georgia for 40 years before being forced on to Oklahoma. Ross’ faction opposed Ridge’s faction in Georgia. Stand Watie was only Ridge leader to survive assassination leading up to Removal to Oklahoma. Federal land grab in Oklahoma was pay back for Nations supporting the South during the WAR!
Yes, they were here before America was "America"
Their claim is stronger than mine. My great grandparents came from Ireland
